The following information must be shown in a sticker put in one end of each Package of Goods for convenient identification and customs clearance thereof at Place of Delivery:

) working days after date of shipment from Port of Loading, the Seller shall promptly inform the Buyer of the estimated time of arrival of the Goods and in the mean time, send to the Buyer by fax the following documents to enable the Buyer to prepare necessary procedures for clearance and taking delivery thereof at Place of Delivery
This Contract shall be governed by and construed in all respects in accordance with the Vietnamese Applicable Law.

This Purchase Contract constitutes the entire agreement between Buyer and Seller and supersedes all prior negotiations or representations related to the agreement, either written or oral. No amendments to this Contract shall be effective unless evidenced in writing and signed by the Parties hereto.

“Goods” means all or part of the articles, materials, equipment, supplies, services and other items described in the Purchase Order and to be supplied by Seller, including without limitation manuals, operating instructions, reports and drawings.

“Purchase Order” means the terms and conditions contained on the face page of the document entitled Purchase Order (the “Front Terms”), the Terms and Conditions contained below, the specification, and any annexes thereto.
“Specification” means all codes, standards, drawings and specifications referred to in the Front Terms or otherwise incorporated into the Purchase Order by reference and to be

“Buyer” and “Seller” mean respectively the person, firm or company designated as such in the Front Terms, including their successors and assigns. Buyer and Seller are sometimes individually called the “Party” and collectively the “Parties”.

If there is a conflict between or among the Front Terms and any other documents comprising the Purchase Order, the Front Terms shall always control. If there is a conflict between or among any other documents comprising the Purchase Order, the priority of control shall be these Terms and Conditions, the Specification, and the annexes thereto. Seller shall bring to the attention of Buyer any ambiguity or uncertainty as to any provision of the Purchase Order. Buyer shall promptly resolve the ambiguity or uncertainty and its determination shall be final. The Purchase Order incorporates the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the Goods and supersedes and merges all prior written and oral understandings and agreements; provided, however, that any guarantee provided by a third party in relation to the Purchase Order prior to the date hereof shall remain in full force and effect. The Purchase Order can only be amended by a writing signed by both Parties.

Seller accepts the Purchase Order by acknowledging receipt by telex or facsimile and/or by signing the acknowledgment copy of the Purchase Order and returning it to Buyer. Any reference to Seller’s conditions of sales in any acknowledgment of the Purchase Order by Seller or in invoices issued by Seller or in any other documents emanating from Seller shall be excluded and shall not be deemed to become part of the Purchase Order by virtue of Buyer’s non rejection of them, or in the case of invoices, by payment thereof.

Seller shall be exclusively liable for all income, sales, use, payroll and other taxes, customs, excise and export duties in the country of manufacture, provident funds and other fees, levies and charges incurred by Seller or its subcontractors and subcontractors and its or their employees directly or indirectly imposed by or payable to any government (including any department, agency or subdivision thereof) with respect to the Purchase Order and the sale and delivery of the Goods. Seller shall indemnify and hold Buyer harmless from any expense, claim, liability or obligation with respect to such amounts. This indemnity shall survive the termination or expiration of the Purchase Order. All of Taxes and Custom duties in

Buyer, after advising Seller in writing, may withhold or deduct from the payment of any amount otherwise payable to Seller under the Purchase Order those taxes and other amounts as Buyer may be required to withhold or deduct under the laws of any country having jurisdiction over Buyer, Seller, its or their subcontractors or all or any part of the Goods. Buyer shall promptly provide Seller with official governmental receipts evidencing payment of amounts withheld and deducted from amounts otherwise payable
to Seller. Buyer’s provision of such receipts shall satisfy Buyer’s obligation to Seller with respect to amounts withheld or deducted.
Except as otherwise expressly provided, all prices for the Goods are firm and fixed and not subject to revision, escalation or adjustment due to currency fluctuations or any other reason.

The prices are fully inclusive of all cost, risk and profit related to Seller’s performance under the Purchase Order. Unless the Front Terms specify otherwise, the prices expressly include all costs associated with containers, packing cases, boxes, tins, wrappings and other packaging material which Seller is required to supply (all which shall be considered as non-returnable to Seller) and all preparation, packing, boxing, crating, freight, or other special services of any kind.
The cancellation of the purchase any items of the Goods after the issuance of the Purchase Order only up to agreement by both parties.

If Seller defaults in the performance of any obligation hereunder, including without limitation time of delivery and/or completion, or if it becomes apparent that delivery or completion cannot be accomplished within the time specified, Buyer may cancel the Purchase Order without penalty and/or liability and charge Seller for losses and damages sustained by reason of such delay or failures. The rights and remedies created hereunder shall be in addition to any other rights and/or remedies may have elsewhere in the Purchase Order or at law. Without limitation to the foregoing, Seller shall be deemed to be in immediate default hereunder if Seller: becomes bankrupt or has a receiving order made against it; presents its petition in bankruptcy or makes an arrangement with or assignment in favour of its creditors; agrees to carry out the Purchase Order under a committee of inspection of its creditors; goes into liquidation or has an execution levied on its equipment or inventory; and/or has otherwise become insolvent or unable to pay its bills when due.

Seller shall conduct all inspections and tests in strict accordance with the requirements of the Purchase Order. Seller shall ensure that Buyer has the opportunity to inspect, tests, and/or witness any tests of the Goods wherever they may be located. Seller shall provide or ensure that its subvendors provide unrestricted access to reasonable facilities necessary for Buyer to carry out such inspections or witness such tests. Buyer shall be entitled to reject any or all of the Goods that do not comply with the Specification and any such rejection shall be final.
Seller represents and warrants that the Goods are free from all defects arising from faulty design, faulty materials or faulty workmanship for period of 12 months from the date of delivery.

Seller shall whenever Buyer requests furnish proof satisfactory to Buyer that all charges for material and labour in respect of the Goods have been fully paid or otherwise discharged. Seller agrees to defend, indemnity, and hold harmless Buyer from and against and all liens, claims, or encumbrances for labour and/or material arising out of or connected with the Purchase Order.

Seller is in default of this provision, Buyer reserves the right to pay directly to any entity or person any or all amounts due from Seller for the furnishing of such labour and/or material. Any such payment will be credited against amounts owed by Buyer to Seller.

Seller shall indemnify, hold harmless and defend Buyer, its customer, and its or their parent, subsidiary, affiliated and associated companies and its or their employees, agents, Contractors and subcontractors from and against all suits, claims, demands and actions of every type and character asserted by any entity or person for bodily injury, death or property damage, arising out of or resulting from any condition or defect in the Goods or from Seller’s performance hereunder, excepting only injury, death or property damage resulting from Buyer’s sole negligence. This indemnity shall survive the termination or expiration of the Purchase Order.

Each party shall assume all liability for and shall defend, indemnify and hold the other party free and harmless, from and against any and all loss, liability, damage, claim, demand, action, proceedings or costs (including legal costs and expenses) arising out of their performance of the Purchase Order, in connection with loss of or damage to the property of Third Parties, or in respect of personal injury to, or death or sickness of Third Parties

If the Goods include services to be performed by Seller, Seller shall carry workmen’s Compensation Insurance as required by law and comprehensive general liability, including Seller’s contratual liability under the Purchase Order, and automobile liability on all owned, non-owned, or hired vehicles, each with minimum limits of U.S. Dollars 1,000,000. If the Goods include materials, Seller shall cany products liability insurance with minimum limits of U.S. Dollars 1,000,000 for each occurrence. All of the above required policies shall contain a waiver of subrogation against Buyer, shall name Buyer as an additional insured and provide for thirty (30) days notice of cancellation to Buyer. Seller shall provide certified copies of such policies to Buyer upon request. Such insurances shall not be in limitation of Seller’s liabilities under the Purchase Order.

Seller shall indemnify hold harmless and defend Buyer, its customer, and its or their parent, subsidiary, affiliated and associated companies and its or their employees, agents, contractors and subcontractors from and against all suits, claims, demands and actions of every type and character asserted by any entity or person in respect of alleged or actual infringement of any patent, copyright or trademark, foreign or domestic, resulting from the use or resale of the Goods. This indemnity shall survive the termination or expiration of the Purchase Order.

Seller shall hold in strict confidence and not divulge to third parties or use for any purpose not related to the provision of the Goods any technical information disclosed, directly or indirectly, to Seller by Buyer, its parent, subsidiary, affiliated or associated companies, including drawings or designs provided by Buyer or prepared for Buyer by Seller, except with Buyer’s prior written approval. At Buyer’s request, Seller shall return all such technical information to Buyer and shall not retain any copies thereof. Seller shall obtain Buyer’s written approval prior to issuing publicity releases or announcements regarding the Purchase Order and/or the Goods. Seller shall also require its subcontractors, suppliers and subvendors to comply with this provision.

Seller shall obtain Buyer’s prior written consent to any proposed subcontract or assignment of any or all of Seller’s rights, duties or obligations under the Purchase Order. Any attempted subcontract or assignment not in compliance with this provision shall be void. Buyer may in its discretion withhold consent to any proposed subcontract or assignment for any reason or no reason. In addition to Buyer’s right to assign Seller’s warranties, Buyer reserves the right to assign the Purchase Order or any part thereof to any parent, subsidiary, affiliated and/or associated company.

The time stipulated for delivery of the Goods or any separable portion(s) thereof shall be of the essence. Without relieving Seller of its obligations and/or liabilities hereunder, Seller shall immediately report to Buyer any actual or foreseeable delay in delivery and its cause. Seller shall take all reasonable action to eliminate the cause(s) of delay.

Unless otherwise stipulated by Buyer on the face of the Purchase Order, (I) transportation on all shipping must be prepaid by Seller via the most economical and direct routing to the “Ship To” address set forth on the Front Terms; (ii) packaging shall be suitable for the type of transportation specified to the designated consignee; and (iii) Buyer shall not be required to pay for the tie-downs, dunnage, packing, packaging or drayage.

Seller shall be solely responsible for all shortages, except only those occurring beyond the F.O.B. Point if Buyer selected the carrier of the Goods beyond the F.O.B. Point. In all cases Seller shall provide reasonable assistance to Buyer to assist in tracing lost or delayed shipments.
Seller will properly mark and segregate the Goods. Each loose item will be marked or tagged with Buyer’s Purchase Order number and item number. Seller will

any special marking specified in the Purchase Order. All shipments must include two (2) legible packing lists, with the description of each item, including serial numbers or other positive identifications. All packages, shipments, correspondence, documents, and invoices must show buyer’s designated company name, Purchase Order number and item number where applicable.
Payment shall be made through T/T within
days by the Buyer in favor of the Seller in the amount of the Order value in United States Dollars upon receipt of goods and shipping documents.

If Buyer disputes all or part of an invoice, Buyer shall return the invoice to Seller specify in writing the reasons for its rejection. Seller may then: (I) resubmit the invoice, corrected to the satisfaction of Buyer or (ii) submit a new invoice covering the non-disputed part of the original invoice. The invoice for the disputed part may be resubmitted after settlement of the dispute.

Buyer’s payment of any amount shall in no case be construed as a waiver of Buyer’s right to object to any paid or unpaid invoice or the Goods represented by such invoice. Buyer shall have the right from the effective date of the Purchase and for one (1) year following the end of the warranty period to carry out an audit (either itself or through a firm of accountants appointed by it) of Seller’s book and records to the extent they relate to reimbursable costs or payment on a day work basis.
From any sum due Seller hereunder Buyer shall be entitled to deduct any amount due Buyer under Purchase Order or any other Purchase Order, agreement, Order, understanding, or obligation between them

Seller shall without additional cost to Buyer supply all required drawings, specifications or other technical data, whether needed for information, approval, or final record, including without limitation maintenance manuals, mill certificates giving chemical composition and mechanical properties, fabrication reports and the like at times and in numbers of copies specified in the Purchase Order. In approving or otherwise receiving Seller’s drawings and related materials, Buyer shall not be deemed to have assumed any responsibility or liability for their accuracy or to have reduced, modified or limited Seller’s obligations and liability under the Purchase Order.

All drawings specifically prepared by Seller in connection with the supply of the Goods or obtained by Seller at Buyer’s cost shall be and remain the exclusive property of Buyer. Seller shall not use such drawings, nor shall it authorize or knowingly permit them to be used by anyone else, for or in connection with any purpose other then the supply of the Goods to Buyer, except with Buyer’s prior written consent. At Buyer’s request, Seller shall return all such technical information to Buyer and shall not retain any copies thereof

Force Majeure shall mean an occurrence beyond the control and without the fault or negligence of the Party affected, including but not limited to acts of God or the public enemy. Force Majeure shall not include: (I) late delivery of materials caused by congestion at a supplier’s plant or elsewhere, or oversold condition of the market, inefficiencies, or similar occurrences; (ii) late performance by a subcontractor or subvendor caused by a shortage of supervisors or labour, inefficiencies, or similar occurrences; (iii) financial distress of Seller or any of its subcontractors or subvendors; (iv) mechanical failure or breakdown of Seller’s or any of its subcontractor’s or subvendor’s equipment or tools.

Should Seller be delayed in the performance of its obligations by an occurrence it believes is Force Majeure, Seller shall promptly give written notice to Buyer. Buyer may at any time contest the existence of an alleged Force Majeure. Delay or failure in performance by either Party caused by Force Majeure shall not constitute default hereunder or give rise to a claim for damages or loss of anticipated profits.

All notices under the Purchase Order shall be in writing and delivered in person to the addressee or sent by postage prepaid airmail, telex or facsimile to the addresses of the Parties specified in the Front Terms or to such other address as the intended recipient shall previously have designated by notice to the other Party. Notices shall be effective (I) if delivered in person, at the time of delivery; (ii) if sent by facsimile or telex, at the time of receipt of the facsimile or telex in normal hours on a business day, provided that a letter of confirmation is also sent; (iii) if sent by airmail, five (5) days after the date of mailing, provided facsimile or telex advise is given of the mailing of such notices.
The interpretation and enforceabiltiy of the Purchase Order shall be determined exclusively according to the laws of
excluding any such laws that may direct the application of the laws of another jurisdiction.
The English language will be the language of the Purchase Order and shall be used in all correspondence, instructions, documents and other data given in connection herewith.

Any disputes, controversy, difference or claims arising out of or in connection with the Order shall be settled by Vietnam International Arbitration Center (VIAC) at Vietnam Chamber of Commerce and Industry (VCCI) in accordance with its Arbitration Rules and Vietnamese Applicable Laws.

Failure of either Party at any time to require the other Party’s strict performance of any obligation under the Purchase Order shall not affect the right to require performance of that obligation. Any waiver by either Party of a breach of any provision of the Purchase Order shall not be construed as a waiver of any continuing or succeeding breach of such provision, a waiver or modification of the provision itself or a waiver or modification of any right under the Purchase Order.
Seller shall at all times be and remain an independent contractor and neither it nor its employees, agents or representatives shall be deemed to be the employees, agents or representatives of Buyer.

Except as otherwise specified herein, Seller shall obtain at its cost all permits and licenses which must be obtained in Seller’s name and are necessary for Seller to perform and complete its obligations under the Purchase Order.
In its performance hereunder, Seller shall comply fully with each applicable law, ordinance, rule and regulation to the extent such compliance does not violate

law. Seller shall indemnify and hold harmless Buyer against any claim or proceeding resulting from breach of this provision. This indemnity shall survive the termination or expiration of the Purchase Order.

Seller shall not pay any salaries, commissions or fees, or make any payments or rebates to any employee or officer of Buyer, or to any designee of any such employee or officer, or favour any such employee or officer or designee with gifts or entertainment of significant cost or value, or enter into any business arrangement with any employee of Buyer other than as a representative of Buyer. Seller’s non compliance of this provision shall be deemed a substantial breach of the Purchase Order.

The Parties’ liability and their role remedy and relief for all matters arising by virtue of such supply or the failure to make such supply (including the failure to supply confirming goods) shall be limited exclusively to the express conditions contained in this Purchase Order / Order. Any other rights not expressly provided herein such as, but not limited to, right of cancellation, termination, restitution or price reduction and any claims for damages irrespective of their grounds (including, but not limited to, tort, breach of Order, impossibility of performance and negligence) or nature, shall be excluded.

In any case and notwithstanding any provisions wherever contained, Seller shall not be liable to Buyer for any indirect or consequential damages, costs and expenses, of whatsoever kind and nature, (i.e., loss of profit, loss of production, loss of business opportunities, etc.) however arising from or related to the execution or the non-execution of this Purchase Order/Order.

SELLER´S maximum aggregate liability in connection with the sale of the Goods or supply of Services, including the breach of any obligation hereunder or under applicable law, and whether any such liability would be based on Order, tort, equity or otherwise, shall not exceed: (i) for breach of the warranties established under article 9: (a) repair or replacement of defective Goods or re-performance of defective Services and reimbursement of the costs and expenses incurred by Buyer in connection therewith, including but not limited to recovery and reinstallation costs up to an aggregate maximum of 10% of the total value of the Purchase Order, or (b) where the defective Goods or Services are repaired or replaced or re-performed by another party, reimbursement to Buyer of the Purchase Order Price paid by Buyer to Supplier for such defective Goods or Services plus 10%,; (ii) for delays in delivery, the maximum amount of Liquidated Damages, or (iii) 8% of the total value of the Purchase Order in relation to which the Supplier has breached its obligations hereunder with respect to any reimbursable damages other than those specified in (i)(a), (i)(b) and (ii) above."
